cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 555 miles E of the northwestern Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest, then west-southwest, approaching the northwestern Bahamas Tuesday–Wednesday and making landfall on the east-central Florida coast Wednesday night before crossing Florida and moving into the northeastern Gulf late Thursday–early Friday and then inland over Georgia/South Carolina early Saturday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (likely near or north of West Palm Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Northwestern Bahamas (Andros, New Providence, Eleuthera, Abacos, Berry, Grand Bahama, Bimini)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwestern Bahamas, Florida peninsula, and portions of the Southeast U.S. coast (GA–SC) late week
weather_observation.wind: Low likelihood (≤6%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; any gusts most likely to remain below gale strength at Mobile.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Mobile Bay from Nicole based on current track well to the east.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands on Nicole’s western flank could bring 1–2 inches of rain to southwest Alabama Friday, well below flooding thresholds.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and rip currents possible along the Alabama coast late Thursday–Friday.
